column3: take eggs in a medium-size mixing bowl. Whisk them well using a wire whisk or a fork. Eggs whisked in a bowl. Add 2 tablespoon finely chopped onions, 1 tablespoon finely chopped tomatoes (seeds removed), 1 tablespoon finely chopped green bell pepper, teaspoon finely chopped green chili pepper, 1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro, ? teaspoon turmeric powder, teaspoon red chili powder, 2 tablespoon milk, and salt to taste to the bowl and whisk well. All the other ingredients except ghee added to the bowl. Ready omelette batter. Heat an 8-inch non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon ghee to the pan and swirl the pan to coat it all over with ghee. You can also make the omelette in oil but ghee gives it a very nice flavor. Ghee added to a pan. Pour the egg mixture into the heated pan and swirl the pan to spread the eggs evenly. Cook on medium heat until the lower side is set and browned. It will take 2-3 minutes. Egg mixture poured in the pan. Flip the omelette using a flat spatula and cook from the other side as well. Serve hot with buttered toast and tomato ketchup
